en.title: Testing a Shiny Application
en.subtitle: Methodology and Practical Tools
en.wanted_kitchen: He wanted to renovate his kitchen
en.shiny_for_client: He had to produce a Shiny application for a client
en.revelation: He had then had a revelation
en.importance_mockup: The importance of a mockup for:
en.swedish_store: Following his visit to that famous Swedish furniture store:
en.bought_everything: He bought everything: furniture, tools, etc...
en.mockup_validated: The mockup is validated with his client:
en.production_time: Now begins the time of production
en.assemble_kitchen: Pierrot will have to assemble his kitchen:
en.be_careful: Be careful not to break anything
en.quality_assurance: Ensure sufficient build quality for years to come
en.material_tested: The material is tested: screws, cabinets, etc... are subjected to load tests
en.what_if_tests: What if Pierrot used tests for his client's Shiny application?
en.tests_allow: Running tests in his Shiny application will allow him to:
en.ensure_no_breaks: Ensure nothing breaks when modifying and/or adding code
en.unit_tests_subtitle:
How to ensure each drawer opens
correctly before installing it in the kitchen...
en.unit_tests_description: Like checking that a drawer opens and closes properly, unit tests in Shiny allow you to:
en.verify_function: Verify that a function returns the correct value
en.test_behavior: Test a function's behavior with different inputs
en.test_individually: Pierrot will test the different outputs of a function, independently of other functions.
en.followed_tutorial: Pierrot followed the #RR25 Monday morning tutorial on {Golem}!
en.shiny_is_package: His Shiny application is therefore a package, which will facilitate the creation of unit tests.
en.create_structure_text: To create the test structure, Pierrot can run:
en.first_step_text: Here, Pierrot just tested a function in his application.
en.however_not_direct: However, he doesn't directly test his application, interactions, etc...
en.secured_business_logic: But he just secured the business logic behind his application.
en.integration_subtitle:
Kitchen furniture is tested individually,
but how do we know if they'll work together?
en.integration_description: Like checking that the fridge door doesn't hit the wall, integration tests allow you to:
en.verify_reactive_flows: Verify proper functioning of reactive flows
en.integration_difference: Unlike unit tests, Pierrot will test interactions between functions.
en.second_step_text: Here, Pierrot just tested the integrations in his application, particularly interactions.
en.secured_functioning: He just secured the proper functioning of his application.
en.tests_remain_programmatic: However, these tests remain "programmatic" and they don't simulate a real browser/user.
en.e2e_subtitle:
Our furniture assembles well in theory,
but how do we know if the kitchen will really be usable by Pierrot?
en.e2e_description: Like actually cooking in the kitchen to ensure everything is functional, end-to-end tests allow you to:
en.test_real_browser: Test the application in a real browser
en.simulate_user_browser: Simulating a user in a browser
en.use_playwright: To test the application in a real browser, Pierrot will use the JS library Playwright.
en.but_r_developer: But Pierrot is an R developer, so he'll use the new R package: {pw}
en.pw_init: pw::pw_init() to initiate the test structure for Playwright
en.very_fast: It goes very fast... but Playwright launches the application in a browser and simulates user behavior.
en.multiple_browsers: Works for multiple browsers: Chromium, Firefox and Webkit.
en.slow_down_trace: We can slow down tests in "trace" mode
en.advantage_generate: Advantage: Playwright offers to generate the code automatically by clicking in the application
en.final_step_text: Here, Pierrot just tested his application under real conditions.
en.secured_complete: He just secured the proper functioning of his application, both on the business logic and UI parts.
en.e2e_ci: End-to-End tests also work in CI to ensure Pierrot continuity in his development.
en.thanks_to_strategy: Thanks to his three-level testing strategy:
en.future_modifications: Future modifications will be more serene
en.kitchen_functional: And his kitchen is perfectly functional!
